website_summaries.verdict: A basic, transportable option that's ideal for some kids, but if yours is older, active, or determined to get out of the corralled area, check out sturdier models on our shortlist.
pros: Lightweight and very easy to fold up for transport or storage
Can be easily positioned in various spacious configurations to fit different areas
Suitable for indoor and outdoor use
cons: Not ideal for active children, as the sides are a bit wobbly
Plastic pieces are prone to cracking and breaking

customer_reviews.title: my baby was hurt.
customer_reviews.text: I will never recommand this to any of you thinking to buy this product. This will hurt your baby!!! My baby was cut by this playard badly and he got blood on his hand. I couldn't get a clear shoot of picture of his bloody finger, but the cut is obviously very deep.
customer_reviews.author: yang chen

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like chemicals, burns tongue and leaves tingling
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate how odd this sounds - But this yard tastes like chemicals and burnt my tongue leaving a tingling feeling after. Thingling has remained even after eating. My daughter regularly mouths the yard when inside it, trying to get to me. So I thought I would too while playing with her. Something is not right with this yard...
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect storable, transportable baby jail
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly with ProSource kids puzzle alphabet. Brought to our parent’s house for thanksgiving- Took less than 60 seconds to pack and secure. Same time to set up. My kiddo loves to cruise (walk while holding onto the fence). If it was possible to tear down, he would have done it already. Makes a great babyjail in our living room that we can tear down with 5 minutes notice if needed. Portable, rugged. Well worth it. Only complaint is that when placed in the shape of a square, the middle sections are prone to flex more and are not 100% rigid like corners are. However, placed into a hexagonal or octagonal shape (as product was intended), it’s completely study.
customer_reviews.author: ER Doc

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!! Sharp broken off plastic!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me with this? I took it out of the box thinking nothing of it and set it in my sunroom unopened. A day later I found a piece of sharp plastic right near my daughter. I had no clue where it came from. Fast forward a couple weeks later I finally decided to open the gate..well I figured out where that sharp piece of plastic came from! It came from this gate! And more pieces of broken off Plastic came piling out! I cannot believe how close my daughter was to just sticking these sharp pieces in her mouth! Do not get this unless you want your child swallowing sharp plastic!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for playpen and blocking off rooms
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son when he was becoming mobile. I would setup a playpen in our living room to contain him while I took care of cleaning or cooking since I could still see him from our kitchen. I also used this to keep him in our living room since we have an open floor plan and baby gates are not an option. These have held up nicely. They are colorful and durable. Definitely recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Heather CTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Mixed
customer_reviews.text: I love and hate this fence. It does exactly what it should do. It keeps your kid away from dangerous stuff. I've found clever ways to use it all over the house. I've re-designed and shuffled many times. I've also injured myself stepping over it more times than I can count. The gate sold separately is way too expensive and flimsy, and way less versatile than you'd like. I don't know of a better fence, and it may not be possible to design one, but it does the job, and you'll hate it all the same.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: nice spacious gate
customer_reviews.text: I have two boys, one and two years old. They are very wild and rough and of course busy boys. This gate helps to contain them while I do chores or cook dinner. My two year old knows how to climb out of it, but for the most part he will stay inside until I let him out. A tiny piece of the gate was already broken off and fell out of the box as I was taking the gate out, but it didn't effect the gate from functioning so this was okay. I purchased a second one for outside since we have an opened space yard with no fence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job but hard to situate into place.
customer_reviews.text: So, it is technically portable and foldable, yes. But man O man is it hard to click to the shape you need and or to foldaway. It takes some man power to situate. Totally doable though! And not even my big kids can knock it over, so once in place, it does it’s purpose. Just isn’t so easy to maneuver. The only reason I removed a star was because of how ridged it is to fold and unfold. That’s all. Other than that, it’s cool. I don’t use for baby, but for a bunny.
customer_reviews.author: Love Leaf Archer

customer_reviews.title: Its so big, plenty of space for baby.
customer_reviews.text: We love it! Plenty of room for baby to move and explore. My 7 month old was ready to start really moving around and pulling himself up. This superyard really holds up and is very sturdy. Shipping was fast and it came in perfect condition. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mechelle

customer_reviews.title: Pain
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike this, due to two issues: 1. This is difficult to open and close, and there is no door on it. Leaving one panel partially undone has led to several “escapes” by my baby. I’ve had to climb in and out instead, but I’m not that tall (5’4”), and I ended up tripping and falling, nearly on my baby. I also scraped and bruised myself real good from that. 2. My family members have all hurt their toes when walking too close to it because of the poor design. I bought another play yard to replace this one. We won’t be using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Watanabe Poemi

customer_reviews.title: Great product, no issues setting up.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Setting up wasn’t too difficult but I can see why others were having problems. It was easier for me to disconnect each section and they connect it the way I wanted to rather that leaving the entire thing connect and moving them into place. I haven’t found any sharp edges or any damage parts as yet, everything seem to be working correctly so far. I received this product about two hours ago so I’ll update if anything changes. It would have need nice if there was a gate for me to go in and out rather that step over East time but that’s not a deal breaker because the little one ensures I stay active.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Durable and Useful
customer_reviews.text: Very good product but I struggled with whether to purchase the one with the walk-through doorways. We got the one without and I wish it had a door some days, but then I wonder if without it, it's more versatile. I think you'll be happy with either in the end it's very useful. We use ours around our couch in our living room to contain our baby and her toys right now. Keeping her out of the TV entertainment center and the games etc and having a baby friendly area for her. I also used 3 panels for a few weeks to make an enclosure with a kennel for some new kittens
customer_reviews.author: flame chick

customer_reviews.title: No longer have to hover lol
customer_reviews.text: So nice to be able to let my little one crawl around without hovering over her to make sure she doesn’t get into something she shouldn’t. She’s not walking yet but she has beeen scaling the walls of this play yard. They wobble a little but hold her weight fairly well. Only reason I’m giving 4 stars is because I bought this in the sand color and now I would like to purchase the gate door in the same color and can’t find it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Put some muscle in to collapsing the panels
customer_reviews.text: Love this gate. Super easy to carry with the built in strap. Had to give it 4 stars on ease of folding bc it does take a little muscle to collapse each panel in alternating directions bc it’s tight, but the tighter the better when it comes to safety of the babes. I use it both in a 3x1x3x1 gate as well as a 2x2x2x2 gate. (Rectangle vs square). 3x1 isn’t as stable as the 2x2 but in both situations, it keeps the babes contained and happy w their toys.
customer_reviews.author: K3ls

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should. Previous comments about edges being sharp did not apply
customer_reviews.text: We bought two-six panel systems. My wife was worried after reading previous reviews about the plastic being sharp and potentially hurting our LO. There were no issues! We purchased 12 panels total to have some flexibility in our configuration. Manufacture says no more than eight panels can be put together. Technically you could put as many as you want together, but I wouldn't be comfortable having a straight run of more than two panels long. Plus an eight panel square (2x2) configuration worked perfect with the 6'x6' play mat we got. For the price and the results this is an excellent baby prison.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Lee

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: This is not user friendly. It is super hard to move and adjust the joints. I have to have my husband do it and he struggles. He is a body builder. It is just hard to pull up and rotate without popping out and feeling like you are going to break it. I wanted to return it and get a different brand but the box was already thrown away. We decided to just make a straight gate to block a room and we have to brave it between the wall and furniture to keep it up so the kids don’t knock it over. If you make the circle it stands fine on its own.
customer_reviews.author: JleeRiv

customer_reviews.title: Already broken when directly out of box- not easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about this for my little 8 month old that is now crawling around like crazy. But was disappointed when parts of the assembly were cracked right out of the box. It also isn't as easy to fold and unfold as I had hoped- its more of a permanent structure. Based on part of it already cracked I am reluctant to change the shape much- originally I had planned on ordered two to have a larger space for her- but glad I only got one. It's a lot of money to already be broken. Disappointed unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Dez

customer_reviews.title: Panels break when folding, super sharp dangerous plastic now exposed
customer_reviews.text: Spent $100 to have the 8 panels. Within 2 times carefully folding it one of the panels broke leaving razor sharp plastic exposed. When a panel breaks you have to remove 2, now were down 2 panels so the enclosure is small. Replacement panels are crazy expensive, like 40% of the price of the whole 8 panel thing. If the replacement panels were cheaper I would rate higher. Not happy that I now have to pay another $40 for a total of $140 to get the full enclosure working again.
customer_reviews.author: Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: This will be perfect to keeps little ones contained outside with us.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of theses to connect together outside to have a dog poop free play area for our babies in the summer. I think these will work just fine tor our needs. The inside of each panel is bowed out a bit so I’m not sure if that will affect its durability or sturdiness. It is a little tough for me to get the panels connected to one another but once they are connected I have no plans on disassembling them - it will stay outside except for winter time. And there is no way a child could get the panels apart once connected.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 2 pound chihuahua puppy
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. I have been looking for a barrier to limit my pups space. This is the first product that she cannot squeeze her tiny body through. The diamond pattern is perfect. Set up was a snap. I may purchase another for the other side of my den. I have a wide open floorplan and this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Play-yard is useful but panels may crack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to keep his toddler from getting into areas that were not safe. My son has been careful about opening and closing the panels but, as is stated in other reviews,some panels will crack and have to be replaced. We've already replaced one panel since we bought it late last year. The play-yard serves its purpose but is not sturdy for long-term usage. Also, my son has been worried that his toddler will soon learn that the panels are not attached to the floor and can be lifted up. You will need to supervise your child if they are really active and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C

customer_reviews.title: Not mobile.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be able to use this indoors and outside and thought it would be easy enough to move around every now and again. It was SO hard to get put together and get it set up the way I wanted I thought I was going to break it. I have a North States 72" Wide Deluxe Décor Baby Gate and thought the play yard would be just as easy to manipulate. As far as sturdiness it was definitely keep my 1 year old contained and I didn't work about it coming down. If you don't plan on moving there play yard this is for you. If you want it to be mobile, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: CEmom

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best things I purchased hands down. Got it when my granddaughter just started crawling. Configures into any shape, also can be stretched across an area to block access to tv, dog food, etc. Easy to take apart and snap together. Very sturdy, will stand alone with little support. I'm still using it for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction issues on both the original order and the replacement.
customer_reviews.text: The gate arrived damaged. We sent it back and requested a replacement. The replacement also arrived damaged - the same part that was broken on the first item was broken on the replacement and several of the panels were warped to the point that the product was unstable. The replacement is going back and we will not be purchasing again. Other than the poor construction issues, the gate was as advertised and I'm really disappointed to have wasted 2 weeks waiting for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Dogs, kids, napping dads? These will keep you safe!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gates about 10 years ago and they got A LOT of use... initially they kept the puppy away from the Christmas tree. Then they kept toddlers away from the Christmas tree. We bought two sets of these and hooked them together to make a really big play area. While they haven't seen much use lately, they're onto another circle of life, headed to my sister's for their young children. They're built so solid, I'm pretty sure they can protect Christmas trees and children for MANY generations to come. I highly recommend this play yard.
customer_reviews.author: ASC

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This purchase ( two more sets of 8) makes our 4th plus we purchased two of the gate sets that each have 2 panels. We originally used them for the grand babies but now we have two small Shih Tsu's and these are the perfect fence for them. We set it up around our motorhome and they are secure and happy. I love the bright colors - they go well with the RV lifestyle- festive! They don't fade or get brittle- we are very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Plastic junk and unsafe!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate this is zero I would. It’s absolute junk for the amount of money. You need two hands to open it and it bends. Super hard to open. It’s just a bunch of plastic junk. Definitely a waste of money. The company purposely makes it so you can’t attach anything else to it. It’s the whole gate or you add a whole other one. You can’t add just one or two of its own panels.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa DiPasquale

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: Likes: -Colors -Able to change shape, move it wherever you want, including outside -Baby is able to play safely and can see where I am while I do things like drink coffee, clean, etc. (Thank you for this wonderful 5+ mins of freedom) Dislikes: -Sometimes my fingers get caught when snapping it together/apart -Sometimes hard to move the sides to change to shape (easy if you have help from another person) -Baby is starting to slide it around, I might need to add some rubber stoppers on the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and just poorly designed -- who comes up with this crap?
customer_reviews.text: First impression: this thing is cheap. Some of the pieces were cracked, but not broken enough to break their functionality. The biggest gripe I have is how hard this thing is to set up and move/adjust. It is NOT just as easy as pressing down on one panel while lifting the other.. You have to really pull one panel while struggling to hold down the other, all the while not pushing and pulling so hard as to disconnect them. If you do that, then you have to really get in there and push and pull. The mechanism and design is just really dumb -- how can you do this while you've got a kid in one hand?
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great value, connect multiple to make a giant play yard.
customer_reviews.text: We connected two of these together to create a big 16-panel play yard outside. They come fully assembled and are easy to connect together. They are all plastic (except for the screws) so we have no worries when it gets wet. Also it is light enough to move around easily. My 18 month old and 3 year old love running around in it. (The 3 year old can climb out when she wants). It’s a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price, easy set up and take down, and spacious!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our soon to be 2 year old. He’s my wild child! This is what I found that was within our price range. It is well worth the price! It’s big enough that your child doesn’t feel trapped/confined, it gives them tons of room to run around and play. It’s easy to assemble and take down. It’s perfect for when you need to get dishes or housework done! I suggest if you don’t have carpet to set it up on to buy a rug or something to put underneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great for living room play area
customer_reviews.text: This gate isn’t easy to fold away and put back together, but we didn’t get this gate for that purpose. We leave this set up in the living room where we can see our daughter when she’s playing during the day or in the evenings. It’s a sturdy gate/play area. Our daughter is 11 months old, and leans against this gate with her full body weight. Gate holds up well. We put a beanbag chair (for our own comfort) in there and hang out with her.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily. VERY POOR Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 8 panel play Yard for my 8 month old granddaughter. It lasted just about 6 weeks before a panel broke exposing a sharp plastic piece. Another panel is showing signs of another crack. We have tried repeatedly to contact the manufacturer both by email and phone without so much as a reply. The product is made of a hard plastic unlike a little more pliable plastic that most children's toys are made from.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hull

customer_reviews.title: A little light
customer_reviews.text: My little boy is pretty strong. He will push thing thing around and walk/crawl where he wants. He's a 1yo, by the way. We use it more to keep him out of the kitchen instead now, since he can push the thing. I did broke 2 of the pieces... It is a bit brittle, but it its defense I was man handling it. The way it snaps on its kind of annoying, but once you figure it out, its not so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Kiem Dang

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: This system is a little flimsy for those kiddos who like to climb or pull themselves to standing, but I feel better knowing my 11 mo old is not cruising the living room floor looking for his brother's smaller toys. My husband or I are usually in there with him just in case, until he's more sturdy on his two feet. Our little one has not been pinched or received any injury from this system. For the most part it's easy to move and is kid friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Kimjim16

customer_reviews.title: Regret no gate
customer_reviews.text: It's fine! I realize now that I should have gotten the version with a gate. I'm constantly climbing in and out. If your baby is pretty self sufficient and doesn't need an adult checking in all the time, this product will be fine. If you're just trying to put your mobile baby in a safe spot while you do some chores but still need to check in on him every few minutes, splurge on the gated play yard!
customer_reviews.author: Kamila

customer_reviews.title: Its 'eh'
customer_reviews.text: As a closed square play area, my 1 year old can push it around the floor to get closer to things. When its open its absolutely useless without the wall mount (sold separately) and useless entirely if it's straight for more than two pannels as my kid can push against it and there is a LOT of bend, a dangerous amount when talking about a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Bonniejane

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to fold
customer_reviews.text: As a kiddy fence, this works. However, I really wish one of the segments had a door. If you're a first time buyer of a kiddy fence, take my advice and find one with a gate/door - you'll thank me later. Also, extremely difficult to fold and unfold. Perhaps that's good so children can't manipulate it, but my wife and I have trouble manipulating it too, so I dunno.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Grand

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Bulky and ugly, very hard to adjust the panels. Several loose plastic strands and some sharp edges. Also, there is no gate which means you need to step over the fence to get in or out - not the safest thing to do with a baby in hand!
customer_reviews.author: ZP

customer_reviews.title: A happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to contain my 15 month old for when I needed to get housework done and he could not have 100 percent of my attention. He likes it, but still wants to be super glued to his momma! The direction says it does not form a square shape ( or was not intended for a perfect sq) however it folded into a square just fine. I do have issues of my toddler wanting to climb the sides, but that’s a given as motor skills progress. All around worth the purchase though! Plus it keeps my dog from licking all over his toys.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Redbone

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this superyard! It's large enough for our 1 year old to walk around freely and have a lot of toys in it without tripping over anything. We needed ot upgrade from our pack-n-play and this was the best decision for us! Our almost 5 year old plays in it as well with her baby brother and has lots of room to run around. The panels themselves move a bit when our son pulls himself up or our daughter leans against it, but the entire unit itself doesn't move. It's really easy to fold up and clicks back into place.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Best option for baby to play safely and not feel cooped up.
customer_reviews.text: I love , love, love this play yard. I have hardwood floors though so I put down two twin mattress pads and a sheet under it for comfort, it then can double as play yard, and nappy time area. It is VERY sturdy as an octagon, but I added in my 2 extra sides and for my living room it works well as a huge square as long as my two couches butt it from either side. It tends to wobble with baby's pulling for balance, but stays up, and stays put. I wish I had this plsy yard for my kids years ago. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: June Minard

customer_reviews.title: I have used these pens for many years now. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these pens for many years now. When I purchased my first, it was to enclose a litter of puppies. This purchase was to "fence" my back yard. I live in a planned neighborhood and the yards are very small. I decided to use this system for a couple of reasons; the first was due to the $5,000 bid for a "real" fence, and the second was because my back yard is surrounded by bushes that I need to be able to trim and wanted something I could move away from bushes for trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We use the all over the house n on our porch. I have them put together in different size sections to use as gates around stairs, blocking off the kitchen n other places. It’s very very study. Because of this it’s kinda hard to put the sections together or take them apart. It’s become a “husband job”. The only downside is we tried to make a corral as pictured but the panels are different so not everyone fits together so the number of pieces we could use for ours wouldn’t snap together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, cumbersome, not very portable at all
customer_reviews.text: We were a bit disappointed in this as it seems unstable and very heavy to move around. We were hoping to use it as a portable play pen. It is too heavy for that - time will tell if it was worth the money as we see how much use we get out of it, but for the moment, we rather wished we would have purchased a more lightweight conventional play pen. This thing is a bit of a pain to set up, move and use.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Tuesday

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly transitional baby gate/play yard option
customer_reviews.text: We love this baby play yard and actually use it as more of a baby gate as well! It is easily folded up for moving and cleaning. You are able to bend the pieces around and protect various spots in your home from the little ones. Or you can create a little play space. There are lots of options with this one. Highly recommend and would purchase again in a heartbeat. (Love the beige color as well)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Visited my uncle and Aunty who had a smaller version and decided to get one. Loved how it was made of plastic instead of metal and that the hinges snap and keep the gate in place and happy there was a larger size! This was the fastest delivery for such a large item. We love the super yard and how easy it is to set up and put away. It's great knowing baby is safe and secure when I need to leave the room. Lots of my relatives have commented on it and how it's a great buy. Also like how there's a strap provided to keep it together while transporting.
customer_reviews.author: Shea Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! I have a 10 month old that doesn't love being contained very long but he actually doesn't mind this! Folds up super easy (I wanted something I could set up & break down easily myself with my husband while he's at work & it doesn't take but a minute). Very happy with my purchase! **Only con so far - due to the locking mechanism it has its super loud opening & closing the panels everytime you set it up & break it down lol but it doesn't bother me**
customer_reviews.author: Paul Laing

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this product because I liked the size and color, but like others reviewed, it breaks easily! Just out of the box and already it was broken. Separating the panels was tough and I felt pulling them apart would end up breaking other ones. I think it felt sturdy and I like the design and color, but the fact it broke so soon shows it could do better on the craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jacinto

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good play pen for our little one. We bought the 8 piece and it provides plenty of room. It does seem a little flimsy so not sure if it can hold alot of weight. It is impossible to open with one hand so if that is important you might want to look at other options. Also, the floor protectors do not provide enough clearance so we are using this ontop of carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Latch is impossible to open and close
customer_reviews.text: This was not good at all. We had to return it. The main problem, and this was a big deal, was that the latch was super hard to open and close and definitely requires TWO hands which is impossible when you’re holding a baby with one hand. The door is also very wide so this only works well for a very large space, and wasn’t a great fit for our place. We got a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wetmore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Play Yard
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect way to provide children with a large, but safe, area to play in. This is my 3rd purchase so that other family members have one as well. It would be great if with the play yard that you provide a fabric bag to put gate in so that when traveling, the gate stays clean and more together before needing.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Great size!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!!! Keeps my son safe when I need finish dishes or other chores. My only regret is not buying it sooner. It’s plenty large and can be manuvored in to whatever shape you need. My only drawback was that it’s not very easy to get snapped and I snapped as far as the panels go. All in all...my husband, son, and myself are loving it!
customer_reviews.author: BlessedMama2018

customer_reviews.title: NO OPERATING GATE! Be forewarned, this could be a back injury waiting to happen.
customer_reviews.text: I wished I had noticed that it doesn't have a gate!!! The only way in or out is to take it apart or lift with your back to get your child or my case, puppy in or out. This isn't a good design for anyone who wants to avoid a back injury. That kind of lean over lifting is prime for throwing your back out. It's too high to step over. Bad design
customer_reviews.author: M. Backes

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love how quickly this came! The box had a tear and when we opened it there was a crack in the corner that’s needed to go together to connect the 2 open sides. It was still able to click into place:) although you have to be kind of strong to do that. I struggled a bit. Using it as a puppy play pin:)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Baby Octagon is a Sanity Saver
customer_reviews.text: I love, love , love that this is made in the USA! I have it set up in my living room as a safe spot to put the baby since he's not crawling and getting into EVERYTHING. Gives him more space than just a pack n play, and gives me a little bit more sanity knowing he's not going to immediately destroy everything in his path. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: J Colepepper

customer_reviews.title: I use it for my terrier
customer_reviews.text: When I'm grocery shopping or cooking, I don't want my dog to run around the house. Therefore, when I'm out of the house or busy inside the house, I put her in this pen. She has food, water, bedding, toys, and a big rectangle of artificial grass on which to poop. My wife says the dog is spoiled. I say the dog knows what she's worth. Anyway, this pen is perfect because it keeps the dog from stealing my wife's underwear.
customer_reviews.author: John Rabson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: LifeSaver
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I didn't buy this with my first! This is such a lifesaver when I need to clean and what not. It's plenty of room for him. He is 18 months currently and doesn't seem to be bored too easily. When he does though, he is one and a half so he can push it. Overall though, I can't tell you the peace it brings to know he's not getting into stuff that could hurt him. We have baby gates throughout the house but he can still access the kitchen (for now) since we have an open floor plan.
customer_reviews.author: IMDAYFAM

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Love it even though my baby hates it lol. The material is durable and sturdy. I bought the 8 panels because I wanted it to be roomy for her. Can be clicked to different shapes. It’s a little hard to maneuver alone because of the size. Def a great deal and worth having for the peace of mind of not having baby wandering off around the house when I’m trying to get chores done.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: If you have twins you need this
customer_reviews.text: This is so versatile. We used it with our twins from 6-12 months. Whether to keep them contained while cooking or to give them a place to play where the dog couldn't get them. We had the door which I recommend. NoW we have this detached and have it surrounding our entertainment center to keep the kids from touching the TV and cords. If you have twins you need this. It is better than 2 pack and plays because it takes up less space and is light weight. It also let thr kids be together which (most of the time)made them happier.
customer_reviews.author: happymomoftwins

customer_reviews.title: dont like it
customer_reviews.text: i hate this gate. its so hard to fold up and store to put away. everyone in the reviews said it was easy to fold ???? its NOT. its way too tight. its super heavy. i am 5’9 138 pound female im pretty strong and it literally hurts my body trying to put this thing away. i wanted something quick and easy. i cant believe i wasted $80 on this . so sad.
customer_reviews.author: FlowaPowa2424

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL PLAY YARD- BUT BE SURE TO BUY THE GATE SECTION AS WELL
customer_reviews.text: My daughter lives in a tiny apt in NYC with husband and baby and it is impossible to really baby proof it, so having this 8 panel play yard has been a godsend for them. It is really tough and well made. I recommend that you buy it with the additional gate section so you don't have to step over it. And I also recommend you purchase those foam play mats if you do not have any carpet, so if your baby is just learning to stand by holding on to the sides, and losing his balance and falling a lot, (like ours is)- he/she will have a soft landing.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy even under lots of strain
customer_reviews.text: I put these panels up a few months ago in my family fun center and while i was a little skeptical that they could take the punishment that some kids can do, they have held up wonderfully, The only real problem i have had was with the gates i purchased with them as they have not been easy to open and close, but that has been secondary to how sturdy they are, especially since I tripped over them not 5 minutes after I put them up. I have yet to see any signs of wear in them. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zack. J

customer_reviews.title: NOT Stable.
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy. Bought for my 8m old who is pulling up. He only weighs 17lbs (35th percentile-so small for his age) and when he holds it to stand the whole side bows and flexes. It isn’t at all stable. Very disappointed. The pics show babies and toddlers but they can easily pull it over. Not safe :(
customer_reviews.author: Genesia

customer_reviews.title: Cage fighter training
customer_reviews.text: Our little 7 month old was getting too big for the plastic tote we were keeping her in so we had to upgrade. Don’t panic we drilled air holes! We are not the worst parents! But this allows her to run free like the good lord intended. Also gets her ready for a cage fighting career so it’s a double cool thing. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pete mobley

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this to keep my one year old son from getting into everything. I was a little nervous since one of the reviews said the material was cheap and her baby got a cut on it, but I went around and felt most of the plastic and it's pretty smooth. The durability of this is pretty great, my son is always pulling things down and pushing stuff over but he hasn't been able to break out of this yet. Overall I'm extremely happy with this purchase, one of the most useful things I've purchased in a long time. The only con is that it doesn't fold up very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Vanna jean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, Great durability and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: My first impression when I took it out of the box was the weight and how light it was yet durable. Also, the size once set up was impressive. Easy to set up and ready to go once I pulled it out of the box. No assembly needed other than connect the fence to itself if you use it as an enclosed space. Between the size, durability and price, it was a great purchase and exactly what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan DeVecchio

customer_reviews.title: Snap, Crackle, Pop,  describes this gate
customer_reviews.text: This gate is hard to set up and take down..Its extremely bulky. The plastic hinges catch and make loud popping noises. It sounds like you're going to break it. It's also hard to snap the gate closed. Once I finally get the beast set up in (octagon) shape, its sturdy, and the kids enjoy playing in it. Since there are soo many other gates on the market, I would suggest looking at other options before purchasing this one.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: It’s great if you want to keep it all together and make a gated off play area. It’s not the easiest to take apart and not as sturdy if you have a climber. I had to take mine apart so I could gate off a couple of different areas in our home as my child grew and it becomes much less sturdy as you do that but it at least keeps my child away from those areas.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: great for puppy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this two weeks ago before our new puppy arrived home. We use it along with the ProSource Kid's Puzzle Play Matto keep him corralled and safe. It's ample space--my husband who's 5'11" and I can both lie down in it at the same time to play with the puppy. It's also sturdy enough that if the puppy bangs against it, it doesn't fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Bko123

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: Really love this but one of our panels snapped near the hinge after having it for just a week. We were gently folding the pen together and the plastic snapped and little pieces are everywhere now :-(
customer_reviews.author: Agustin

customer_reviews.title: Broken but still usable
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with a slightly deformed piece. It still works, but I am now a bit weary to buy the other product I considered (the addition to it- gate with door) because I worry about buying and being disappointed. Otherwise it all clicked in well and can be used, they should check all products made for babies very thoroughly though.
customer_reviews.author: Fallon

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a life changer. My child is a 9 month old ninja and can find anything that is tiny and looks delicious, even if that is a penny and means we will be spending the night in the ER getting said penny removed from his esophagus 🙃 Luckily, I found this gem and I can now leave the room periodically to do things like pee in peace! I do suggest getting the door extension. My 6 year old keeps endangering her life climbing in and out so that will absolutely be our next purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: A life saver
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and flexible enough to fit in any room. It is large and keeps our 1 year old safely with her toys and out of mischief. Countless hours of safe play time have been enjoyed within this structure. Easily large enough for adults to join toddlers inside.
customer_reviews.author: JoMart

customer_reviews.title: Dog mom
customer_reviews.text: I wrote my review on the 2-panel extensions... oh well. We've used these 8 panels plus the 2 panel extensions for protecting our Christmas tree and presents from a puppy, doggie safe zone when camping or working outside and also as a puppy playpen in our living room for a quick spot to put puppy when not able to supervise... The only thing I would say is that you really have to muscle the panels together and to change the configuration but once done it is pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose. A door attachment would be nice so that you don’t have to step over it all the time. Ended up using it to block off areas of the house instead of as a playpen. It takes some effort to bend. The push down to adjust feature isn’t the best so we just force bend it without pushing down when adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Xc010

customer_reviews.title: Perfect whelping box!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for whelping box! I can leave one side open to let momma in and out until puppies are old enough to punch it open, them momma can jump in and out. I can run blankets completely to the edge so little puppies don’t get in underneath blankets and suffocate. I can easily step over no problem, but my LO can’t get to the puppies :) I know this was designed for kiddos but it’s perfect for what I needed too. In picture I closed one corner off so I could put space heater nearby but puppies can’t accidentally touch it :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our small space and our baby who's learning to move
customer_reviews.text: We use this to create a safe space for baby. Where I know I can put her down and she won't roll any where, the dog won't step on her, and where I don't have to say "no." We live in a one bedroom house, with no office or other closed off space and this helped create a space just for baby and her toys. Also, North States had great customer service. When I got the play yard, one of the panels was damaged. I emailed them immediately with a photo and we had a replacement panel in days.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great for a sibling shared playroom.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old daughter gets so frustrated when her 1 year old brother tries to take her Barbie toys. They are all just the way she wants them and he comes in like a tornado! Now my son can play freely with his toys and she isn’t bothered by him. I think these are meant for keeping babies in- but for me- it perfect for keeping him out! Now my daughter has a baby free zone all to herself.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Ann Cone

customer_reviews.title: works fine, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use it as an indoor free standing gate/divider for our dog. The only thing is that it's not designed to be used for frequent folding/unfolding, because this thing is hard to put away. I guess it's good but if you want to fold/unfold a few times a day, you need to be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few weeks of normal use - not pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a stationary play yard for a mostly non-mobile baby in my living room. I folded it up maybe three times in a few weeks to vacuum (don't judge) and the third time, it cracked! Now it's too sharp and unstable to use. I'm disappointed because an older version of this play yard is still going strong as an outside play area. Definitely a big step down in terms of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Works great, can get creative about where to setup
customer_reviews.text: We have a huge living room and I wanted our daughter that had just started walking at 11 months to have a big area to play and learn to walk freely without danger and I padded the floor so it doesn’t phase her at all when she falls, these click together and I used extra pieces than is recommended to make a larger area, but I have extensive construction experience and I secured the pieces with screws/zip ties etc so it will not fall over... even if our daughter runs full speed into it which she doesn’t frequently and laughs...
customer_reviews.author: Wulfers

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Really big and perfect for an active baby or toddler. My only issue is that it isn’t as sturdy in the square shape like they say it will be. It is only sturdy in an octagon or hexagon shapes. Maybe for a immobile infant but once your little one is active best to keep it in those two shapes for safety reasons.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: no door
customer_reviews.text: The photos give the impression that there is a door, but there isn't. It is extremely hard to open, and probably not safe to do so when there is a baby inside, as you need to exert a lot of force. I guess the idea is to just throw the baby inside?...
customer_reviews.author: OD

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and collapse!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I have baby #3 coming in November and needed a play pen, but we also got some baby bunnies and it has such a great dual purpose! Gives them a safe place to stretch their legs. Easy to set up and collapse, very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and tall enough to keep 2 and 3 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and tall enough to keep 2 and 3 year olds in and quite large. My only complaint is it’s biggest plus. It’s kind of hard to open/ separate the pieces. This was for my 60+ Mom who watches my niece and nephews. She can’t open it at all BUT it came with a sort of belt with clips that stores all the pieces together when stacked. We use that belt as a sort of make shift latch. The kids aren’t strong enough to unclip the belt and it’s way more easier for my mom. So it worked out overall
customer_reviews.author: becauseilovealf

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a very Mobile 11 month old! Works great! I saw some pics where the gates had broken. You can fold all the pieces together for storage w/o unconnecting each slat but you need to be careful at the hinges. If you don’t close with equal force, I could see that the hinges would crack. I just take each panel apart. I’m confident that this playpen will last for my growing family for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Rizzle

customer_reviews.title: Nice colorful play yard!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this play yard. I love the colors, I love how big it is and that the panels are pretty flexible so you can have it where it's in a straight line and looks like a wall or shape it any way you like. It does the job and it keeps my baby secured. The only downside is that my 9-month old baby crawls and uses the panels to hold onto. They wobble a lot and she has lost her balance due to them not being very sturdy. It's nothing very major and I'd still recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: mtkuma83

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to add a safe place for our 9 month old. To our amazement this playpen helped our daughter to grasp it and pull herself up. We credit this playpen for giving our baby the extra motivating to start to grab pull herself up and start walking. She is 13mos now and still loves being in her playpen. The colors are vibrant and we are very happy with this purchase. Actually we are planning on buying more panels to expand her play area....
customer_reviews.author: Seasnoopy

customer_reviews.title: playpen
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to move around and play! Pros: -My son can move around and play with his toys. -This pen adjust to different sizes (you can add or remove panels). -This pen is pretty sturdy for my little one. -Good price. -Does its job. Cons -The pen has to be fully connected in order to use. For instance, I am not able to use it to block off an area because my son knows how to push it out of the way. -The pen is difficult to connect (push pieces together). -The playpen is colorful (which can be a con if you wanted a solid color but a pos if you like less expensive products).
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Glover

customer_reviews.title: Man oh man, I use this gate for everything ...
customer_reviews.text: Man oh man, I use this gate for everything. When my son started climbing over his baby bead, I used one of the panels to block the bed from the changing table. I use it to block a section up stairs so he cannot go through a railing and fall. I rarely use the whole gate, but each section comes off and have been able to use it for a multitude of things. :)
customer_reviews.author: DGI

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to open or work with.
customer_reviews.text: It’s too short compared to my evenflo one. I loved my evenflow one but it was only 6 panels & we needed a bigger one & they were out of stock for 8 panel. This one is almost impossible to lock! It is so hard to open & close. I’m definitely considering sending back ASAP. Wouldn’t recommend at all. Maybe a dog gate idk. It’s too difficult to even deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie S

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Good quality! Stiff hinges!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gate! I've purchased 2 to keep my wild one year old contained in one area or keep him out of things. The only problem with it is that the gate is really hard to bend. The hinges on the gate are super hard to manipulate to the shape you want. It takes a minute to get it bent to the shape you want but once its formed to the shape you want it stays which is awesome. It is very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Stevi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The first few times opening and closing were hard, but after I got it moving a little it became easy to use. I love it and, more importantly, my baby loves it! She has free reign of the entire area that it covers (and that's a lot of area). Would definitely buy again if I need more space for her.
customer_reviews.author: Nae

customer_reviews.title: Keeps 18 month old safe
customer_reviews.text: It keeps a very active 18 month old contained. I was surprised she could not push it over. She tries to climb in her bare feet but gives up when she figures out it's uncomfortable to stick her toes in those small slots. We put the pad from her playpen in one corner so she has an area to lie down or "read" her books.
customer_reviews.author: rodisi

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping an 8 month old crawler in one area
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 8 month old crawler super easy set up pretty much just pull it out of the box and unfold. The colors are very bright, eyecatching. Wish it was a little more sturdy but will definitely work for now.
customer_reviews.author: Pink

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: I am not particularly impressed. We got the 8 panel version and even though it takes most of our living room I would not get a smaller one just because it gives some moving room. I don't find it very sturdy, it moves. Also, I set it up as a perfect octagon and the next thing i know the shape is different: somehow those connections snap by themselves and change the angle. And are 8 plastic panels actually worth $110? On the positive note, the customer service is great. One of the panels had broken plastic pieces when we got it and they shipped a replacement immediately.
customer_reviews.author: RockyFan

customer_reviews.title: WHOA Little One!!
customer_reviews.text: As our grandson began crawling, pulling up on furniture and becoming ever-more curious, this Superplay “containment center” became a must. A few weeks after rhe 8-panel came, I ordered a gate and extra panel to safeguard the baby AND the kitchen! Now, in this pulling up stage, I don’t worry about him turning firniture over on himself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best to keep toddlers out
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST. I used it with the padded foam letters and numbers to build a nice play area for my daughter. This way I can get stuff done around the house while she plays. Its a little big and I liked how I could get the plain tan color versus the multiple colors. Its lightweight and works well. While my daughter is now 11 months old and we have a Christmas tree up, this blocks her from knocking down any antique ornaments.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan j Danek

customer_reviews.title: If you have a baby you NEED this.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our baby once she started crawling and let me tell you it has been a LIFE SAVER. Maybe I should say sanity saver. I don’t have to worry about what she’s getting into while she is inside it. It’s easy to assemble right out of the box and easy to take down. Great buy all around.
customer_reviews.author: Wendelynn

product_meta.title: Toddleroo by North States Superyard Colorplay 8 Panel Baby Play Yard: Safe play area anywhere. Folds up with carrying strap for easy travel. Freestanding. 34.4 sq. ft. enclosure (26" Tall, Multicolor)
product_meta.description: Style:8-panel| Color:ColorplayNow that baby’s on the move, create a safe and engaging play area anywhere–inside or out–with the brightly colored Toddleroo by North States Superyard Colorplay. The high-quality, eight-panel yard encloses up to 34.4 square feet and is 26 inches high. Won’t slip or scratch, works on any surface. The Superyard Colorplay sets up in seconds, and the convenient carry handle makes this lightweight yard easy to bring the fun with you. To increase the play area, a Two-Panel Extension kit is available separately. Toddleroo by North States products are solidly constructed from the highest-quality materials to withstand rigorous day in, day out use. Assembly Tip: As you unfold each panel, you will hear a clicking sound which is the self-locking positioning feature. This intended feature gives the play yard added strength and stability.
feature_bullets: NEW NAME - SAME GREAT BRAND YOU TRUST: Designed for both indoor and outdoor use, the Toddleroo by North States Superyard Colorplay is an excellent solution for creating a safe playpen for your child. Plus, the convenient Folding ABC Play Mat (sold separately) works great with this play yard. It provides extra comfort and sensory stimulation during tummy time or any time!

SAFETY & CONVENIENCE: This play yard sets up and folds up quickly. Comes complete with carrying strap and non-slip pads. Fun for your child, peace of mind for you! Plus, the durable plastic is kid-tough and difficult for either pets or children to climb.
VERSATILE: This durable plastic eight-panel colorful play yard creates up to 34.4 square feet of protected play space.

EXTRA-WIDE BARRIER: Using a maximum of 6 panels, the play yard can now act as an extra-wide safety barrier with the use of the "Superyard Wall Mount Kit" (sold separately). It's the perfect solution for homes with open floor plans or large spaces that need blocking off. Fits openings from 38 1/2 inches to over 16 feet wide.
BABY SAFE: Safe for babies ages 6-24 months. Proudly made in the USA.

specifications.Safety warning: Check the included instruction manual for a complete list of safety warnings. You will also find the PDF of the manual on the Amazon listing
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,038 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
